revised_title: Monte Carlo Simulation Studies of Anisotropic Systems: Pretransitional Effects in Nematogens
tldr: The authors studied the pretransitional behavior at the nematic-isotropic transition for two systems using computer simulations and the Monte Carlo technique. They used the Lebwohl-Lasher model and a truncated dispersion potential to analyze the second-rank Kirkwood factor. The results showed that the factor diverged as the nematic-isotropic transition was approached, in agreement with the Landau-de Gennes theory. The study provides insights into the pretransitional effects in nematogens and the role of molecular structure in their behavior.
